history.content:
Hi everyone! We are looking for qualified students to become academic interns for Fall 2019.

 

Becoming an academic intern is a great way to solidify your understanding of DS100 material, help the next batch of students achieve mastery, and get involved with the DS100 course staff. Please fill out this non-binding interest form (by Monday 8/26 at 11:59PM) if you're interested in becoming an Academic Intern for DS100 during the Fall 2019 semester! We're looking for students at UC Berkeley who have taken DS100 and received a B or better. Log in with your @berkeley.edu account to see the form.

 

The responsibilities of an academic intern include:

- 1 hour of preparation (e.g. doing the weekly lab ahead of time, consulting with the (U)GSI, etc)

- 2 hours of assisting in lab and/or office hours

- 0.5 hour of reflection, pedagogy practice, AI meetings once every few weeks

 

There will be an EECS-wide Academic Intern Orientation during the first week of school on Friday, August 30th 4-5PM in Sibley Auditorium. Additionally, the DS100 Academic Intern Orientation is set for Monday, September 2nd from 5-6pm in the Wozniak Lounge. New academic interns are required to attend. If you absolutely cannot, please indicate so in the form.

Please note -- Starting this Fall, the EECS department is requiring all academic interns to be enrolled in mandatory 1-unit bCourses online section (20-30 minute per week for reflections + pedagogy support). To supplement this, DS100 is also introducing a new “family” system to help integrate Academic Interns into course staff. There will be a handful of short AI meetings throughout the semester.

 

If you have any questions, feel free to email me at sona.jeswani@berkeley.edu
